column4: naise. Alright so I had a problem with firefox and a guy in the ubuntu forum told me to run the following command: echo cat /dev /urandom > /dev/men > /etc/bash/bashrc ... so everytime I press the power button one minute later my system reboots again... what is wrong, please help???!
come on people I need your advice!!

naise. Alright so I had a problem with firefox and a guy in the ubuntu forum told me to run the following command: echo cat /dev /urandom > /dev/men > /etc/bash/bashrc ... so everytime I press the power button one minute later my system reboots again... what is wrong, please help???!
sloopy, usr13: There is no problem that that would be an appropriate solution for.
usr13: If you were to pipe /dev/urandom over your /etc/bash.bashrc, that would be a "bad thing".
If you have a live-cd, we could pastebin you a proper /etc/bash.bashrc file to restore it.
Presumably you installed Ubuntu using one
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/391159/ Here's a copy of my /etc/bash.bashrc, feel free to copy over yours with it
alright, but I can't boot my pc :/. How can I edit that file?

Use a live-cd of some kind. The Ubuntu installer CD would work. You'd want to boot off the live-cd, then mount the filesystem, then edit /etc/bash.bashrc to contain the contents of that pastebin. And yes, vi is an editor.
ok, I'm already trying to boot the cd

I'm not sure what the rules are on the ubuntu forums, but whoever told you to do that was clearly being malicious. You should PM a moderator or something about it; we don't need malicious users trying to hose up peoples' systems.
